text:
hey everyone welcome to Pai's kitchen so the 
holiday season is coming up and last week

I showed you an edible gift recipe on hot Thai 
Kitchen if you've missed it up with a link right

up here today I have another recipe for you and 
this one I actually made for all of my friends a

couple years ago for Christmas and they all loved 
it there are these date truffles so its dates with

chocolate and nuts and dried fruit spices it's 
so good and they're also vegan and gluten-free

and all that jazz so you can give them through 
all of your friends regardless of their dietary

needs let's get started so the main ingredient is 
of course dates so I've got here medjool dates and

I like medjool dates because the texture tends to 
be a little softer than the other sort of no-name

dates I'm not sure what priety they are other 
ones will work too just saying I prefer this

one now I'm going to start by processing these 
in my food processor we got to be really careful

here my food processor is anything but powerful so 
I'm going to do this just half at a time so once

it starts to ball up in the food processor that's 
all I need I don't need it to be completely fine

I'm going to be mashing it with my hands later 
on so this is totally fine goodness and now my

add-ins and this is where you can really customize 
it I've got a mix of dried fruit and nuts here

and if you've got friends with nut allergy you 
can totally do this with seeds instead of nuts

all right so I've got pistachios walnuts cashews 
dried apricots and dried cherries I particularly

chose dried cherries because they're tart and I 
would recommend choosing dried fruits that have

a tartness to them and it will help balance the 
sweetness of the dates really well okay so don't

go with all raisin because that's just sort of 
sweet on sweet and now we're going to make these

chocolaty and this is where the truffle part comes 
in I've got some cocoa powder which I'm going to

sift right into here and I mix a cocoa powder in 
with the dried fruits because it'll help separate

the dry fruit pieces because you don't want them 
sticking together in the date balls now I'm not

done yet but I'm also going to add some spices 
this is totally optional it's a holiday season

so I like to add sort of Christmassy spices like 
cinnamon and nutmeg don't overdo nutmeg it doesn't

taste great if you've put too much but it's a 
wonderful combination with cinnamon so just a

touch just going to sift all that and the sifting 
helps distribute the nutmeg and the cinnamon and

the cocoa so that you never really end up with you 
know a chunk of dry cocoa powder and now just a

little pinch of salt to balance out the sweetness 
and I'm going to just stir that around all right

oh you can add shredded dried coconut in here 
if you want sunflower seeds anything you like

now the date goes in and this part I am actually 
going to use my hands to knead this in but if you

have a stand mixer like a Kitchen Aid you can use 
the paddle attachment and get it to mix it for you

I just mind it's quite hard on the motor however 
if you're going to use your hands and make sure to

wash them and they're really really really clean 
because these are not getting cooked so you know

this is it so I'm gonna go wash my hands with 
soap before I start mashing these clean hands

now if you're thinking well why don't you wear 
gloves I've tried that and then what happened

was the date stick to the gloves and as I pull 
it like grabs onto my gloves just this is just

the easiest way to do it and I find it easier to 
just flatten out the dates first and then put the

dried fruits and nuts in it and then just fold 
it and need it like bread when I made them for

my friends a couple years ago actually labeled the 
balls of labour and love no kidding when you are

processing the dates if you find the dates really 
dry and it was hard to get them going I have had

in the past to add just a tablespoon of hot water 
and let the dates soak in that hot a little bit

and it helps the dates process and that is it 
now you want to taste this this is your first

time make sure you're happy with the flavor you're 
happy with the ratio of nuts to fruit spices and

all this stuff can definitely adjust this to 
however you want and now to portion these out

I just find these little gestures really handy 
this is a size 60 just FYI just like that and I

find that if you keep wetting your dish every once 
in a while it prevents the dates from sticking too

much to it alright so now I'm going to roll them 
into balls and dust them into coconut and they're

gonna be pretty and snowy and beautiful I like 
to wet my palm just a little it helps with the

sticking you don't have to and just roll them 
in your hands until they're nice and round and

then I've got two options today for Roland's I've 
got some desiccated coconut make sure you get the

small small fine ones because that's going 
to look fluffy and cute but big chunky ones

don't look it's nice and then I've also got some 
pistachios if you want some nice green ones this

is going to be a little more expensive so options 
for you now I like to make sure I really press it

down and that's it look how cute those are and 
they look like snowy little chocolatey balls now

these are healthier than your traditional baked 
goods because there's no refined flour in here

no mind you dates do have a lot of sugar so I'm 
not saying these are diabetic friendly however

they also have a lot of fiber and that fiber will 
help to slow down your sugar absorption a little

bit so they're still still not as guilty as the 
other ones look how cute these are there's white

ones and green ones and if you want to roll them 
in other things it's up to you now I'll show you

how I packaged these for gifts a couple years ago 
so I got these cute little bags from the Japanese

dollar store and then I just put a few you know 
and these are really heavy so I think I just gave

a couple to each person and then I fold it and 
then I got these stickers also from the Japanese

dollar store I think these came together and you 
seal it like that and then I made a little label

beause of Labor and love like that this is from 
two years ago and like this is literally what I

called them I listed all the ingredients in the 
back so if anyone's got questions about what's

in them they can check out that list and there are 
these little wooden pegs there you go that's how

I package them this is something you can also do 
as well I'll put them in mason jars whatever you

like now time to eat Oh smell of the coconut mmm 
so good it's sweet and sticky so it feels super

sinful with that chocolate flavor but it's not 
too sweet because of all the nuts we add and you

notice I added more nests in it at dry fruit and 
that's that was intentional and I have a hard time

believing but there's no added sugar in here no 
flour it's all just fruit and nuts and chocolate

by the way here's a little fun fact did you know 
that states are actually picked off the trees just

like that they're not dried separately they ripen 
and dry right on trees cool so I hope this gives

you a good idea for something you can make for 
the holidays it's super fun to make and get your

friends involved your kids involved I got Adam 
involved and the recipe will be on Pais kitchen

comm again that's a brand new website where I 
put all of my non Thai recipes from pi schism

so make sure to check that out and I will see 
you next time for your next delicious adventure
and you get your friends involved
